Field Description: The date of the person's activity summary
Description Source: Contrived using  FITBIT API - get-daily-activity-summary.

Field Description: The number of calories burned for the day during periods the user was active above sedentary level. This includes both activity burned calories and BMR.
Description Source: Almost word for word FITBIT API - get-daily-activity-summary.

Field Description: Total BMR calories burned for the day.
Description Source: Almost word for word FITBIT API - get-daily-activity-summary.

Field Description: Total calories burned for the day
Description Source: Almost word for word FITBIT API - get-daily-activity-summary.

Field Description: The elevation traveled for the day displayed in the units defined by the data source. When src_id is PTSC, the unit is feet. When src_id is TPC, the unit is meters.
Description Source: The elevation traveled for the day displayed in the units defined by the Accept-Language header. For src_id = PTSC, en_US was the accepted language header, so the unit is feet.  For src_id = ce, data was stored in metric system so the unit is meters.  Per https://dev.fitbit.com/build/reference/web-api/developer-guide/application-design/#Unit-Systems Additional link

Field Description: Total minutes the user was fairly/moderately active.
Description Source: Almost word for word FITBIT API - get-daily-activity-summary.

Field Description: The floors provides ONLY the count of how many floors the Fitbit device counted as the user ascended in elevation. The researcher can determine how many "feet" or "meters" the user climbed as the device determines a floor every time the user ascends 10 feet (3 meters). Essentially 1 Floor = 10 Feet (3 Meters).
Description Source: The equivalent floors climbed for the day displayed in the units defined by the Accept-Language header. For src_id = PTSC, en_US was the accepted language header. For src_id = TPC, all data was stored in metric units. However, the Floors API does not return a measurement of elevation, only a count of how many floors the Fitbit device counted as the user ascended in elevation. The researcher can determine how many "feet" or "meters" the user climbed as the device determines a floor every time the user ascends 10 feet (3 meters). Essentially 1 Floor = 10 Feet (3 Meters).
